span.title: EHDS refined base model for This type is for containing or referencing attachments - additional data content defined in other formats. The most common use of this type is to include images or reports in some report format such as PDF. However, it can be used for any data that has a MIME type.

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: A generic, flexible model for any kind of discharge report. Different types of encounters may require adding relevant sections and elements, or omitting irrelevant ones, depending on their data needs.

short.value: Discharge Report model

definition.value: A generic, flexible model for any kind of discharge report. Different types of encounters may require adding relevant sections and elements, or omitting irrelevant ones, depending on their data needs.

short.value: Document header

definition.value: Basic metadata for this information

short.value: Patient/subject information

definition.value: Patient/subject information

short.value: Unique identifier of the document

definition.value: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

short.value: The author of the report.

definition.value: The author of the report.

short.value: Date of finalising/issuing the document

definition.value: Date and optionally time of authoring/issuing

short.value: Status of the document

definition.value: Status of the document

short.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

definition.value: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

short.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

definition.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

short.value: Type of document at hand, e.g. 60591-5 Patient summary document.

definition.value: Type of document at hand, e.g. 60591-5 Patient summary document.

short.value: Human readable document title that can be displayed in search results, etc. This can be documentType's display name, or it can be assembled from multiple elements. Examples: 'Laboratory Result Report', 'Patient Summary of Jane Green 10.12.2024'

definition.value: Human readable document title that can be displayed in search results, etc. This can be documentType's display name, or it can be assembled from multiple elements. Examples: 'Laboratory Result Report', 'Patient Summary of Jane Green 10.12.2024'

short.value: Time of service that is being documented (typically the same as the time of encounter)

definition.value: Time of service that is being documented

short.value: Business version of the document. The exact algorithm for versioning is decided by the producer/custodian.

definition.value: Business version of the document. The exact algorithm for versioning is decided by the producer/custodian.

short.value: Document attestation details

definition.value: Document attestation details

short.value: Attester who validated the document. Multiple attesters could be provided.

definition.value: Attester who validated the document. Multiple attesters could be provided.

short.value: Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester.

definition.value: Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester.

short.value: Document legal authentication details

definition.value: Document legal authentication details

short.value: The person or organisation taking responsibility for the medical content of the document (typically the person who signs it)

definition.value: The person or organisation taking responsibility for the medical content of the document (typically the person who signs it)

short.value: Date and time when the document was authorised.

definition.value: Date and time when the document was authorised.

short.value: Categorisation of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement between data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purposes.

definition.value: Categorisation of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement between data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purposes.

short.value: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

definition.value: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

short.value: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.

definition.value: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.

short.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

definition.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

short.value: Intended recipient(s) of the information, i.e. a person or organisation that should be notified or be aware of the content. This element is used to indicate explicit communication intent and does not represent routine storage or passive availability of information (e.g. in portals). Listing an intended recipient does not create an assignment or responsibility.

definition.value: Intended recipient(s) of the information, i.e. a person or organisation that should be notified or be aware of the content. This element is used to indicate explicit communication intent and does not represent routine storage or passive availability of information (e.g. in portals). Listing an intended recipient does not create an assignment or responsibility.

short.value: Structured body of the discharge report document

definition.value: Structured body of the discharge report document

short.value: Section: Alerts.

definition.value: Information about substantial alerts or warnings (including allergies) that health professionals should be aware of.

short.value: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the whole section.

definition.value: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the whole section.

short.value: Description of medical alerts in textual format: any clinical information that is imperative to know so that the life or health of the patient does not come under threat.

definition.value: Description of medical alerts in textual format: any clinical information that is imperative to know so that the life or health of the patient does not come under threat.

short.value: Section: Encounter information.

definition.value: Section: Encounter information.

short.value: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the whole section.

definition.value: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the whole section.

short.value: Encounter information

definition.value: Encounter information

short.value: Free text notes by the health professional

definition.value: Free text notes by the health professional

short.value: Section: Admission evaluation. Admission evaluation section should be reported only if it is relevant to ensure continuity of care.

definition.value: Section: Admission evaluation. Admission evaluation section should be reported only if it is relevant to ensure continuity of care.

short.value: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the whole section.

definition.value: Narrative, potentially formatted, content of the whole section.

definition.value: Section: Patient health history (anamnesis) containing only information that is highly relevant for this specific episode of care. The model is designed with the expectation that patient summary is available.

short.value: Problems that were treated or affected provisioning of care (diagnostics, therapy, nursing, monitoring) during the encounter. At least one treated problem should be marked. Other problems are recorded only if they are important for continuity of care (after discharge).

definition.value: Problems that were treated or affected provisioning of care (diagnostics, therapy, nursing, monitoring) during the encounter. At least one treated problem should be marked. Other problems are recorded only if they are important for continuity of care (after discharge).

short.value: Procedures performed during encounter which are significant for continuity of care, e.g. surgeries and other instrumental interventions (endoscopic, intravascular), chemotherapy, radiotherapy, purification methods (dialysis, hemoperfusion), circulation support methods (counterpulsation, etc.), administration of blood derivatives or others. Diagnostic procedures are typically captured as observation results and not repeated here.

short.value: Medical devices (including implants) whose use was started, stopped, or otherwise modified during the encounter.

short.value: Procedures performed during encounter which are significant for continuity of care, e.g. surgeries and other instrumental interventions (endoscopic, intravascular), chemotherapy, radiotherapy, purification methods (dialysis, hemoperfusion), circulation support methods (counterpulsation, etc.), administration of blood derivatives or others. Diagnostic procedures are typically captured as observation results and not repeated here.
